Sentencas: Effects of strain on the surface cation chemistry and the electronic structure are important to understand and control for attaining fast oxygen reduction kinetics on transition-metal oxides.
Titulo: New Insights into the Strain Coupling to Surface Chemistry, Electronic Structure, and Reactivity of La0.7Sr0.3MnO3

Sentencas: Here we demonstrate and mechanistically interpret the strain coupling to Sr segregation, oxygen vacancy formation, and electronic structure on the surface of La0.7Sr0.3MnO3 (LSM) thin films as a model system.
Titulo: New Insights into the Strain Coupling to Surface Chemistry, Electronic Structure, and Reactivity of La0.7Sr0.3MnO3

Sentencas: Our experimental results from X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and scanning tunneling spectroscopy are discussed in light of our first principles-based simulations.
Titulo: New Insights into the Strain Coupling to Surface Chemistry, Electronic Structure, and Reactivity of La0.7Sr0.3MnO3

Sentencas: A stronger Sr enrichment tendency and a more facile oxygen vacancy formation prevail for the tensile-strained LSM surface.
Titulo: New Insights into the Strain Coupling to Surface Chemistry, Electronic Structure, and Reactivity of La0.7Sr0.3MnO3

Sentencas: At 500 degrees C in 10(-3) mbar oxygen, both LSM film surfaces exhibit a metallic-like tunneling conductance, with a higher density of electronic states near the Fermi level on the tensile-strained LSM surface, contrary to the behavior at room temperature.
Titulo: New Insights into the Strain Coupling to Surface Chemistry, Electronic Structure, and Reactivity of La0.7Sr0.3MnO3

Sentencas: Our findings illustrate the potential role and mechanism of lattice strain in tuning the reactivity of perovskite transition-metal oxides with oxygen in solid oxide fuel cell cathodes.
Titulo: New Insights into the Strain Coupling to Surface Chemistry, Electronic Structure, and Reactivity of La0.7Sr0.3MnO3
